info.name: Statping
info.description:
Statping API Documentation for all endpoints to manage your services, users, groups, notifiers, messages, and more. 

## API Requirements

- `endpoint` variable should be the URL of your Statping instance.
- `api_key` variable is the API Secret key from the Settings page and is used for the Authorization Bearer token.

item.name: Services

request.description: View an array of all Services added to your Statping instance.
View a specific service, this will include the service's failures and checkins.
View the chart data for the service's latency. The response returns an array of objects as `x` for timestamp, and `y` for value in ascending order.
View the chart data for the service's ping response time. The response returns an array of objects as `x` for timestamp, and `y` for value in ascending order.
View the data service failures in a heatmap. The field `x` is the day of the month, and `y` is the amount of failures the service had.
Returns an array of failures for this service. It includes the error message, http status code, and the ping response time.
Returns on array of all the successful hits for this service.
Reorder services in a specific order for the index page.
Create a new service and begin monitoring.
Update a service with new values and begin monitoring.
Delete a service and stops monitoring.
Delete all the service failures.

item.description: With the Statping API, you can add, remove, edit all your services fields from the API directly. This includes viewing Service chart data for latency/up-time, and even viewing a log of failures.

item.name: Groups

request.description: View an array of all Groups added to your Statping instance.
View a specific group
Create a new Group to organize services.
Reorder services in a specific order for the index page.
Delete a group and removes all services attached to this group.

item.description: Statping allows you to group multiple services with a unique name for better viewablity. You can reorder the groups to make your status page a little more organized if you have tons of services.

item.name: Users

request.description: View all users on your Statping instance.
Create a new Statping user
Update a user's information including username, email, password, and if they are an admin or not.
Delete a specific user from the database.

item.description: You can create new users with different permissions to allow for read only API access, and super admin abilities.

item.name: Notifiers

request.description: View an array of all the Notifiers including all details about the notifier.
View a specific notifier and it's details.
Update a notifier to change it's values.

item.description: Statping contains multiple notifiers that will send you a notification whenever a service become offline, or online. You can create your own 3rd party notifier by reading more on the [Notifiers Wiki](https://github.com/hunterlong/statping/wiki/Notifiers) on the Github repo.

item.name: Messages

request.description: View an array of all messages inserted into the database.

request.description: Update a specific message with new details.
Delete a specific message from the database.

item.description: Messages allows you to create an alert for a service for a scheduled downtime, or a simple message letting users know a service might be having internal issues.

item.name: Checkins

request.description: Create a new Checkin.
View an array of all the Checkin's inserted into the system.

exec: pm.test("Hit the Checkin API Endpoint", function () {

request.description:
Initiate the Checkin request to your Statping instance. This request will come from your service and will trigger a failure if your service does not hit this URL in the routine interval set.

- `checkin_id` is the ID for the checkin
View a specific checkin and it's details.
Delete a checkin from database and stop failures from service not hitting the checkin URL.

item.description: A Checkin is when a service communicates to your Statping instance rather than Statping attempting to hit your service. Checkin's have a scheduled interval that waits for your service to notify Statping, if your service does not hit the Checkin URL during the interval you set, it will result in a service failing notification.

item.name: Miscellaneous

request.description: The root API endpoint to view basic Statping configuration including Name, URL, database type, and other useful fields.
This endpoint will clear all the cache files in your Statping instance. This includes chart data and service views.
Reset your root API Key and Secret values to brand new values.

item.description: This is for Statping's miscellaneous API endpoints that aren't a part of another category.
